First, I need to understand what the Wilson curve is. From Document [0], I learn that the curve of Wilson is the across arch curvature or posterior occlusal plane, defined by a line drawn from left mandibular first molar to right mandibular first molar. This suggests that the Wilson curve is seen in molars. However, to confirm this, I need to check if the Wilson curve is also seen in premolars or anteriors. Document [1] mentions the cusp tips of canines, buccal cusp tips of premolars and molars, and palatal/lingual cusp tips of second molars in relation to the curve of Wilson. This suggests that the Wilson curve might be seen in all of these teeth. However, the document does not explicitly state that the curve of Wilson is seen in premolars or anteriors. Therefore, based on the information available, it seems that the Wilson curve is primarily associated with molars. So, the answer is "A. Molars".
